REST API Database¶

db.py¶

models.py¶

class src.database.models.Contact(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

Model for the ‘contacts’ table.

Attributes: - id: Primary key. - name: The name of the contact (required). - surname: Last name of the contact (required). - email: Email of the contact (unique, required). - phone: Phone number of the contact (unique, required). - birthday: Date of birth of the contact (required). - created_at: Date the record was created (automatic). - updated_at: The date the record was last updated (automatic). - info: Additional information about the contact. - user_id: Foreign key for binding to the user. - user: The relationship to the User model.

birthday¶
created_at¶
email¶
id¶
info¶
name¶
phone¶
surname¶
updated_at¶
user¶
user_id¶
class src.database.models.User(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

Model for the ‘users’ table.

Attributes: - id: Primary key. - username: Unique username of the user. - email: Unique email address. - hashed_password: The encrypted password. - created_at: Date the record was created (automatically). - avatar: URL of the user’s avatar. - confirmed: Whether the user is confirmed. - role: The role of the user (USER or ADMIN).

created_at¶

class src.database.models.UserRole(value)¶

Bases: str, Enum

List of user roles.

Values: - USER: The normal user. - ADMIN: Administrator.

ADMIN = 'admin'¶
USER = 'user'¶

class src.repository.contacts.ContactRepository(session: AsyncSession)¶

Bases: object

async create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User) → Contact¶

Create a new contact for the user.

async get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user: User) → Contact | None¶

Get a contact by ID associated with a specific user.

async get_contacts(name: str, surname: str, email: str, skip: int, limit: int, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

Get a filterable list of user contacts.

async get_upcoming_birthdays(days: int, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

Get a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

async is_contact_exists(email: str, phone: str, user: User) → bool¶

Check if there is a contact with the specified email or phone number for the user.

async remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User) → Contact | None¶

Delete a user contact by ID.

async update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User) → Contact | None¶

Update an existing user contact.

users.py¶

class src.repository.users.UserRepository(session: AsyncSession)¶

Bases: object

async confirmed_email(email: str) → None¶

Mark the user’s email as confirmed.

Parameters: - email: str – the email address to mark as confirmed.

Returns: - None

async create_user(body: UserCreate, avatar: str = None) → User¶

Create a new user in the database.

Parameters: - body: UserCreate – the data used to create the user. - avatar: str | None – optional URL of the user’s avatar.

Returns: - User: The newly created user.

async get_user_by_email(email: str) → User | None¶

Retrieve a user by their email address.

Parameters: - email: str – the email of the user to retrieve.

Returns: - User | None: The user if found, otherwise None.

async get_user_by_id(user_id: int) → User | None¶

Retrieve a user by their unique ID.

Parameters: - user_id: int – the ID of the user to retrieve.

Returns: - User | None: The user if found, otherwise None.

async get_user_by_username(username: str) → User | None¶

Retrieve a user by their username.

Parameters: - username: str – the username of the user to retrieve.

Returns: - User | None: The user if found, otherwise None.

async update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str) → User¶

Update the avatar URL for the specified user.

Parameters: - email: str – the email of the user whose avatar is to be updated. - url: str – the new avatar URL.

Returns: - User: The updated user.

REST API Services¶

auth.py¶

contacts.py¶

class src.services.contacts.ContactService(db: AsyncSession)¶

Bases: object

async create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User)¶

Create a new contact for the given user.

Parameters: - body: ContactModel – the contact data to create. - user: User – the current authorized user.

Returns: - Contact: The created contact object.

Raises: - HTTPException: If a contact with the same email or phone already exists.

async get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User)¶

Retrieve a single contact by its ID.

Parameters: - contact_id: int – the ID of the contact to retrieve. - user: User – the current authorized user.

Returns: - Contact: The contact object if found.

async get_contacts(name: str, surname: str, email: str, skip: int, limit: int, user: User)¶

Retrieve a list of contacts filtered by name, surname, or email.

Parameters: - name: str – filter by name. - surname: str – filter by surname. - email: str – filter by email. - skip: int – number of records to skip (pagination). - limit: int – maximum number of records to return. - user: User – the current authorized user.

Returns: - List[Contact]: A list of filtered contacts.

async get_upcoming_birthdays(days: int, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

Get a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays within a number of days.

Parameters: - days: int – number of days from today to look ahead. - user: User – the current authorized user.

Returns: - List[Contact]: A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

async remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User)¶

Remove a contact by its ID.

Parameters: - contact_id: int – the ID of the contact to remove. - user: User – the current authorized user.

Returns: - Contact: The removed contact object.

async update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User)¶

Update an existing contact with new data.

Parameters: - contact_id: int – the ID of the contact to update. - body: ContactModel – the new data to update the contact. - user: User – the current authorized user.

Returns: - Contact: The updated contact object.

email.py¶

upload_file.py¶

class src.services.upload_file.UploadFileService(cloud_name, api_key, api_secret)¶

Bases: object

static upload_file(file, username) → str¶

Uploads a file to Cloudinary and generates a URL to access the image.

Generates a unique identifier for the user and uploads the file to the server. After successful upload, returns the URL of the image with certain parameters (size, cropping).

Arguments:

file: The file to upload. username: The username to generate a unique public_id.

Returns:

str: URL of the image available on Cloudinary.

users.py¶

class src.services.users.UserService(db: AsyncSession)¶

Bases: object

async confirmed_email(email: str)¶

Mark a user’s email as confirmed.

Parameters: - email: str – the email to confirm.

Returns: - None

async create_user(body: UserCreate)¶

Create a new user and generate a Gravatar avatar if possible.

Parameters: - body: UserCreate – user registration data.

Returns: - User: The newly created user.

async get_user_by_email(email: str)¶

Retrieve a user by their email address.

Parameters: - email: str – the email of the user.

Returns: - User | None: The user if found, otherwise None.

async get_user_by_id(user_id: int)¶

Retrieve a user by their unique ID.

Parameters: - user_id: int – the ID of the user.

Returns: - User | None: The user if found, otherwise None.

async get_user_by_username(username: str)¶

Retrieve a user by their username.

Parameters: - username: str – the username of the user.

Returns: - User | None: The user if found, otherwise None.

async update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str)¶

Update the avatar URL of the user.

Parameters: - email: str – the email of the user to update. - url: str – the new avatar URL.

Returns: - User: The updated user.

schemas.py¶

class src.schemas.ContactModel(*, name: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=2), MaxLen(max_length=50)], surname: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=2), MaxLen(max_length=50)], email: EmailStr, phone: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=7), MaxLen(max_length=20)], birthday: date, info: str | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

A model for creating or updating a contact.

Attributes:

name: the name of the contact (minimum 2 characters, maximum 50 characters) surname: surname of the contact (minimum 2 characters, maximum 50 characters) email: email address of the contact (minimum 7 characters, maximum 100 characters) phone: phone number of the contact (minimum 7 characters, maximum 20 characters) birthday: date of birth of the contact info: additional information about the contact (optional)

birthday: date¶
email: EmailStr¶
info: str | None¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

name: str¶
phone: str¶
surname: str¶
class src.schemas.ContactResponse(*, name: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=2), MaxLen(max_length=50)], surname: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=2), MaxLen(max_length=50)], email: EmailStr, phone: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=7), MaxLen(max_length=20)], birthday: date, info: str | None = None, id: int, created_at: datetime, updated_at: datetime | None)¶

Bases: ContactModel

A model for responding when receiving a contact from the database.

Attributes:

id: unique identifier of the contact created_at: date and time when the contact was created updated_at: date and time when the contact was last updated (optional)

created_at: datetime¶
id: int¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'from_attributes': True}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

updated_at: datetime | None¶

class src.schemas.User(*, id: int, username: str, email: str, avatar: str, role: UserRole)¶

Bases: BaseModel

A model for representing a user.

Attributes:

id: unique user identifier username: user name email: user’s email address avatar: URL to the user’s avatar role: the role of the user (for example, administrator or user)
